content.body: the actual behavior in Chrome appears to be, you can synchronously send messages _except in an onmessage handler_, which is pretty bizarre
content.formatted_body: the actual behavior in Chrome appears to be, you can synchronously send messages except in an onmessage handler, which is pretty bizarre

content.body: Oh wow nice find. Sad to hear my speculation was so off the mark.

I'm in a bunch of spec-related servers (because I reference the specs a lot, as I'm making an implementation of them)
But I always feel out of place in these servers, because the people in them are more focused on actually developing them
And also, these channels seem super-formal
i always wear a tuxedo on matrix
EveryOS: no need to feel out of place, all are welcome
content.formatted_body: EveryOS: no need to feel out of place, all are welcome

wait do we not have to?

content.body: Yoav Weiss: Domenic: do either of you happen to know what happened to maintenance of https://github.com/w3c/longtasks/issues?
content.formatted_body: Yoav Weiss: Domenic: do either of you happen to know what happened to maintenance of https://github.com/w3c/longtasks/issues?

content.body: in terms of who owns this spec?
Yoav Weiss: well it seems the Perf WG owns it, but it hasn't been moving along the REC track
content.formatted_body: Yoav Weiss: well it seems the Perf WG owns it, but it hasn't been moving along the REC track

content.body: Yoav Weiss: and issue addressing went kinda silent a couple years ago
content.formatted_body: Yoav Weiss: and issue addressing went kinda silent a couple years ago

content.body: There was a FPWD in 2017 and that's it
From the eng side, it can use a little more attention. I'm hoping to make progress on attribution later this year
On the spec/WG side, it was adopted to the WG with one implementation. The amount of progress in can make on the REC track without a second implementation is limited
Any specific issues you feel need addressing?
Not sure, but I imagine some are not really up for being addressed if Chrome has shipped this for that long
And for some I wonder what ended up being implemented, e.g., elsewhere Perf APIs do account for long URLs, but here the issue is still open
